document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Reitter, E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Reitter, E. (1880) Die Gattungen und Arten der Coleopteren-Familie: Scaphidiidae meiner Sammlung. Verhandlungen des Naturforschenden Vereines in Brunn, 18, 35 - 49. [Note: nominal year of publication 1879]

subSubSection.paragraph: 4 species are known from and are restricted to Central and South America.
Characters/Description: Löbl & Leschen 2003: 316 (characters); Leschen & Löbl 2006: 19 (characters in key). Key: Löbl & Leschen 2003: 316 (species of the genus).

bibRefCitation.author: Erichson, G. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Erichson, G. F. (1845) Naturgeschichte der Insecten Deutschlands. Erste Abtheilung, Coleoptera, Vol. 3. Verlag der Nicolaischen Buchhandlung, Berlin, pp. 1 - 320.

subSubSection.paragraph: 5 species are known from and are restricted to South America.
Characters/Description: Löbl 1974: 39 (characters); Leschen & Löbl 2006: 19 (characters in key).

bibRefCitation.author: Erichson, G. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Erichson, G. F. (1845) Naturgeschichte der Insecten Deutschlands. Erste Abtheilung, Coleoptera, Vol. 3. Verlag der Nicolaischen Buchhandlung, Berlin, pp. 1 - 320.

subSubSection.paragraph: 24 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
South America: Colombia , Galapagos Isl., Brazil , Chile , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.
38 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Key: Matthews 1888: 171 (species of Central America); Fierros-Lopéz 2006: 67 (Mexican species).
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Belize , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Peru , Brazil , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.
10 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Costa Rica .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental .
